abstract:
<jats:p>We revise the genus <jats:italic>Metaplagia</jats:italic> Coquillett, 1895 and describe five new species from Area de Conservación Guanacaste (ACG) in northwestern Costa Rica. All new species were reared from an ongoing inventory of wild-caught caterpillars spanning a variety of species within the family Sphingidae (Lepidoptera: Sphingidae). Our study provides a concise description of each new species using morphology, life history, molecular data and photographic documentation. In addition to the new species, the authors provide a re-description of the genus and a revised key to the species of <jats:italic>Metaplagia</jats:italic>.</jats:p>
          <jats:p>The following five new species of <jats:italic>Metaplagia</jats:italic> are described: <jats:italic>Metaplagia leahdennisae</jats:italic> Fleming &amp; Wood <jats:bold>sp. n.</jats:bold>, <jats:italic>Metaplagia lindarobinsonae</jats:italic> Fleming &amp; Wood <jats:bold>sp. n.</jats:bold>, <jats:italic>Metaplagia paulinesaribasae</jats:italic> Fleming &amp; Wood <jats:bold>sp. n.</jats:bold>, <jats:italic>Metaplagia robinsherwoodae</jats:italic> Fleming &amp; Wood <jats:bold>sp. n.</jats:bold> and <jats:italic>Metaplagia svetlanakozikae</jats:italic> Fleming &amp; Wood <jats:bold>sp. n.</jats:bold></jats:p>
          <jats:p>The following is proposed by Fleming &amp; Wood as new combination of <jats:italic>Plagiomima</jats:italic> Brauer &amp; Bergenstamm, 1891: <jats:italic>Plagiomima latifrons</jats:italic> (Reinhard, 1956) <jats:bold>comb. n.</jats:bold></jats:p>
title: Revison of Metaplagia Coquillett (Diptera: Tachinidae) with description of five new species from Area de Conservación Guanacaste in northwestern Costa Rica
